result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Frankie L Bowlin in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to case #15CM577.
Defendant signed bond
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. No contact with any Pick N Save store.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Frankie L Bowlin did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was supposed to appear by video but the call didn't go through.  Defense moves to reinstate bonds in both cases.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court grants defendant's motion in both cases and orders the signature bonds reinstated with all conditions to remain as previously set.  Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
